title.narrative: Poverty Action Lab South East Asia - Phase II

description.narrative: The Poverty Action Lab South East Asia (J-PAL SEA) Phase II aims to help the Government of Indonesia (GOI) create a more productive, inclusive Indonesia by pursuing the twin objectives of: strengthening evidence-informed policymaking; and increasing the capacity of Indonesian and regional researchers and policymakers to generate, use and design high-quality economic policy research. Phase II will focus on three core activities: research; policy outreach; and capacity building. It will build on the strong results achieved during the Phase I which contributed to major policy impacts in Indonesia, including by helping GOI to scale-up social programs reaching some 65 million Indonesians. Phase II will expand the thematic scope of J-PAL SEA’s work from the current phase’s focus on social programs to policy questions relating to inclusive growth, human capital and employment, domestic resource mobilisation and inclusion.
